summary.claim: Surrealist memes can be seen as a driving force in the progression of meme art

perspectives.text: Surrealist memes approach the absurdity of contemporary life in the same manner as Dadaism, which contended that art doesn’t need to make sense if governments and societies don’t make sense either.

By referencing Dali in the same image as Pepe the Frog, surreal memes accomplish another central goal of Pop Art – to mix high and low culture and elevate ordinary, daily items into the world of fine art.
This ongoing dialogue between various art movements and surreal memes points to the latter’s power as a driving force in the progression of meme art.

summary.claim: Surrealist memes have a regressive nature

perspectives.text: The nihilism of surreal memes reveals their regressive nature. At its core, art is about evoking emotion and sharing our experiences of the world. Art writer Linda Weintraub writes “If art doesn’t sensitize us to something in the world, clarify our perceptions, make us aware of the decisions we have made, it’s entertainment.” Internet memes, both popular and obscure, do give their audiences pause, drawing attention to the ills of our world with humor or shock value.
Surreal memes can only “progress” through the intensification of nonsense ad nauseum.
The DNA of Dada was self destructive [sic]; so too is the DNA of the surreal meme.

summary.claim1: Friends has set the bar and path for the creation of more successful sitcoms.
summary.claim2: Seinfeld revolutionized television, which is quite impressive for a show “ about nothing ”.
summary.claim3: Friends was skillfully unique in that it was a fun, light comedy that succeeded to have its characters evoke feeling about life’s struggles rather than just laughter.

query: Should Gwyneth Paltrow be admired or criticized?

summary.claim: Gwyneth Paltrow should be admired for her ability to redefine modern family and her resilience in the face of sexual harassment.

perspectives.text: Paltrow has shown the resilience by being one of the first actresses to come forward about having been sexually harassed by Harvey Weinstein. In so doing, she helped start a global conversation about sexual harassment in the workplace.
Paltrow has also shown the ability to redefine today’s modern family by keeping things friendly between her ex-husband and her current husband.
She has also been a strong advocate for women's rights and has used her platform to raise awareness about issues such as sexual harassment and gender pay inequality.

summary.claim: Gwyneth Paltrow should be criticized for her pretentious and condescending behavior towards the common woman.

perspectives.text: Paltrow’s past claim that “I’m incredibly close to the common woman” comes off as condescending.
Paltrow’s participation in the 2015 SNAP challenge against food hunger could have been inspiring, but instead she was patronizing when she bought six limes with her allotted $29-a-week budget.
Paltrow has also been accused of promoting pseudo-scientific products and services that are not backed by science.

summary.claim: Reality TV can have a profoundly negative impact on the lives of its participants, often leading to divorce, addiction, and mental health issues.

perspectives.text: Reality TV stars are often portrayed as having a superficial and overexamined life, leading to negative consequences such as divorce and addiction.
The constant scrutiny and pressure to conform to societal norms can take a toll on the mental health of reality TV participants.
The portrayal of reality TV participants can perpetuate negative stereotypes and reinforce harmful societal norms.
The emphasis on physical appearance and material possessions in reality TV can contribute to the objectification and commodification of human beings.
Reality TV can also perpetuate the idea that fame is the ultimate goal, leading to a culture of narcissism and entitlement.
The negative impact of reality TV on its participants can be seen in the numerous high-profile cases of addiction, mental health issues, and divorce among reality TV stars.

summary.claim: Reality TV can have a profoundly positive impact on society, promoting diversity, inclusion, and social change.

perspectives.text: Reality TV has provided a platform for marginalized groups to share their stories and promote social change.
The portrayal of diverse families and communities on reality TV can help to break down social barriers and promote understanding and acceptance.
Reality TV has the power to challenge societal norms and promote positive change by presenting alternative perspectives and lifestyles.
The success of reality TV shows featuring diverse casts can help to increase representation and diversity in media.
Reality TV can also provide a platform for social commentary and critique, allowing viewers to engage with complex social issues in a more nuanced and thoughtful way.
The positive impact of reality TV on society can be seen in the numerous examples of social change and positive impact that have resulted from reality TV shows.

query: Should we Fight or Embrace Illegal Downloads?
